entries.title: ‘Your pain is my pain’: Pope Francis meets Congolese victims of conflict
entries.description: “I condemn the armed violence, the massacres, the rapes,” said the pope, before repeating his criticism of “an insatiable greed for raw materials and money that fuels a weaponized economy.”

entries.title: Ozzy Osbourne cancels 2023 tour dates, says spinal injury means his 'touring days have ended'
entries.description: Heavy metal legend Ozzy Osbourne announced the cancellation of his 2023 tour dates in the U.K. and continental Europe.

entries.title: Countries in the Americas should reinforce abortion protections, rights commission urges
entries.description: The Inter-American Commission on Human Rights (IACHR) called for countries to reinforce abortion protections, observing measures that “go backwards” last year.

entries.title: Iran jails couple shown dancing at Freedom Tower in viral video
entries.description: A young couple who posted a video of themselves dancing romantically in the streets of Tehran have been sentenced to several years in prison, according to human rights activists and Iranian authorities.

entries.title: 'Live fast, die young': An endangered marsupial may be mating itself to death
entries.description: The male northern quoll, a small endangered marsupial, is walking so far and sleeping so little in its desperate search for sex that it may be causing its own early death, according to a study published Wednesday.

entries.title: Teachers, train drivers, civil servants join largest U.K. strike in over a decade
entries.description: The biggest day of strike action Britain has seen in more than a decade comes as unions step up pressure on the Conservative government to demand better pay amid a cost-of-living crisis.

entries.title: Iranian dancing couple jailed, activists say
entries.description: A young couple who posted a video of themselves dancing romantically in the streets of Tehran have been sentenced to several years in prison, according to human rights activists and Iranian authorities.

entries.title: Pope Francis holds Mass during trip to Congo
entries.description: Pope Francis was met by thousands of people lining the streets of Congo’s capital, Kinshasa, after his fifth trip to Africa was rescheduled from last year. NBC News’ Claudio Lavanaga breaks down what to expect from the pontiff’s trip to Congo and South Sudan.

entries.title: In Mexico, 15 grade school students are treated for internet drug 'challenge'
entries.description: In Mexico, 15 grade school students were treated after apparently taking part in an internet “challenge," taking tranquilizers to see who can stay awake longest.

entries.title: Missing radioactive capsule found in Western Australian
entries.description: Search teams have found a radioactive capsule that was lost along an 870-mile stretch of highway in Western Australian. Authorities said they had "quite literally found the needle in the haystack."

entries.title: U.S. accuses Russia of endangering nuclear arms control treaty
entries.description: Russia’s refusal to allow on-the-ground inspections to resume is endangering the New START nuclear treaty and U.S.-Russian arms control overall, the Biden administration charged on Tuesday.

entries.title: Day of disruption in U.K. as up to half a million join 'walkout Wednesday'
entries.description: Thousands of schools in the U.K. are closing some or all of their classrooms, train services will be paralyzed and delays are expected at airports Wednesday.

entries.title: Hong Kong bans CBD categorizing it a 'dangerous drug'
entries.description: Hong Kong has banned the use of CBD, categorizing it as a “dangerous drug” and mandating harsh penalties for its smuggling, production and possession.

entries.title: Hong Kong bans CBD, forcing businesses to shut or revamp
entries.description: Hong Kong banned CBD as a “dangerous drug” and imposed harsh penalties for its possession on Wednesday, forcing fledging businesses to shut down or revamp.

entries.title: 2 years after Myanmar coup, resistance to military rule is holding strong
entries.description: The prospects for peace in Myanmar, much less a return to democracy, seem dimmer than ever two years after the army seized power, experts say.

entries.title: Radioactive 'needle in the haystack' found in Australia as tiny capsule is recovered in the outback
entries.description: A tiny but highly radioactive capsule that went missing in the Western Australian outback was found Wednesday after a frantic weeklong search covering an 870-mile stretch of highway.

entries.title: Driven by desperation, Rohingya refugees risk their lives at sea
entries.description: Seeing no future as refugees as Bangladesh, growing numbers of Rohingya Muslims are risking their lives on dangerous boat journeys to other countries.

entries.title: 4 key suspects in the assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse are in U.S. custody
entries.description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico — Four key suspects in the killing of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse were transferred to the United States for prosecution as the case stagnates in Haiti amid death threats that have spooked local judges, U.S. officials announced Tuesday.
